circumstances:  
- eclipse 2.1 (gtk) installed to /opt/eclipse  
- user workspace is at ~/workspace/.... 
- open Install/Updates perspective 
- add http://eclipse-tools.sourceforge.net/updates/ url 
- start to install ... accept the licence agreement, and after that, shows an empty 
selection for install destination, instead of /opt/eclipse, and throws NPE
Do you have write access for /opt/eclipse?

I can confirm this bug with a clean installation of Eclipse 3.0 M8 GTK on Fedora
Core 1. This seems to be a platform dependent bug. I don't see this problem with
Debian woody/Eclipse 2.1 GTK, Solaris/Eclipse 2.1 and 3.0M8 or Windows 2000 SP
4/Eclipse 2.1 or 3.0 M8.

Additional steps to reproduce/more info:
After I accepted the license, I can choose the location on my disc but this list
is empty. Nevertheless I can click finish and get a null pointer exception.

If I try to add a new site, I get the error message ("site already exists").
This error message appears 2x. 

Please upgrade severity to "major" or "critical". I'm willing to help with
additional debugging information if needed.

Can you try the latest build? There have been some fixes on the target page 
that may have solved your problem.

problem is gone with 3.0 Build 200404071337 (couldn't use newer versions as
Linux GTK wasn't available).

status = fixed for me.

Closing.
If anybody still has problem with the newer builds, please re-open.
